Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively

Since the function already uses os.walk that will iterate through all

The recursive call was not just redundant, but also had another problem,
where we were passing relative paths to subdirectories, which made the
function to attempt importing modules that are not located under the
topdir. It could crash, or, worse, import a module that is
not under the expected parent directory.

This patch also modifies an existing unit test for the function to

subject: Fixes process checker using older psutil versions
commit_message:
Fixes process checker using older psutil versions

Generally, psutil is restricted to versions older than 2.0.0
in OpenStack [1].

Because of this, there can exist nodes with psutil older than 2.0.0.

The data from Process object are accessed differently, depending on
the version. For example, in older versions, this is valid:

process.name()
process.pid
process.username()
process.cmdline()

While in older versions than 2.0.0, those are not methods:

process.name
process.pid
process.username
process.cmdline

Transforming the Process object into a dict solves the issue, as it
behaves the same across different psutil versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L142

Closes-Bug: #1592695

Change-Id: I9b0ff7a666ac9900809f8e4dc07d2b2afbe43516

commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'ceilometer_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

subject: PoC Dynamic iPXE with core+vendor API
commit_message:
PoC Dynamic iPXE with core+vendor API

Adds new endpoint `v1/ipxe` to serve iPXE boot scripts
directly from Ironic API.

The endpoint is public and requires no authentication.
Note that although API version is bumped to 1.23, this endpoint does not
check the requested API version and relies solely on config option
enabling it, as iPXE firmware can not insert custom HTTP request headers.

New config options to this regard:

- `CONF.pxe.enable_ipxe_server` to enable this new API (default is False)
- `CONF.api.restrict_ipxe` to restrict iPXE config fetch to only nodes
  in appropriate states (default is True), similar to
  CONF.api.restrict_lookup
- `CONF.api.ipxe_script_template` points to Jinja2 template of iPXE
  boot script, default is $pybasedir/drivers/modules/ipxe.j2

To support this feature deploy driver interfaces are expected
to inherit from new `IPXEDeployMixin` class and implement
`get_ipxe_options` method.
This patch adds implementation based on AgentDeploy as IPXEAgentDeploy
interface.

Boot script API:

Request: GET v1/ipxe?mac=<mac>&node_uuid=<node-uuid>

Description:
resolves Ironic API and renders Jinja template
for iPXE boot script directly in API w/o RPC calls to conductor.
Both `mac` and `node_uuid` are optional but at least one of them must be
provided, with node_uuid taking precedence.
Using the `?mac=` form is mostly suitable for standalone Ironic
where external DHCP server can be pre-configured to generate
appropriate PXE opts for DHCP response using the MAC of requester.

Boot config:

Request: GET v1/nodes/<node-uuid>/vendor_passthru/ipxe_config

Description:
implemented as vendor passthru extension, this call fetches boot config
and then serves it from API.

Change-Id: I5d2b275e6f0ecfe6dcaf63ef9d6ad73f4a47b191
Related-Bug: #1526275

subject: Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side
commit_message:
Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router. Let this become
the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Related-Bug: #1607381

subject: Wait longer for installer to be ready
commit_message:
Wait longer for installer to be ready

After starting the VM for building the basedisk, we currently wait for
5 seconds for the installer to be ready before we start sending our
prepared keyboard input.

This patch increases the waiting time to 10 seconds.

Rationale: 5 seconds is just about enough. On a fairly typical laptop,
it becomes a race, on a slower laptop, chances are the installer won't
be ready by the time we start giving it commands. If we don't wait long
enough, the installation will fail. Ideally, we would have a different
method of detecting that the installer is ready. For now, we just have to
try and err on the side of caution.

commit_message:
Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.
